Creating a Topic

To start a threaded conversation, you must first create a topic.

To create a topic:

  1. Select a folder from the project tree.

  2. Select the Topics tab.

  3. Do one of the following:

    • Select New from the Topic menu or context menu.

    • Click the New button on the toolbar.

    The New Topic dialog opens.

  4. In the Topic tab, enter the title of your topic in the Title text box.

  5. Enter your remarks in the Content text box.

  6. (Optional) Select the Options tab if you want to send the topic to specific team members, assign a priority to the topic, or indicate a status for the topic.

    1. To send a topic to specific team members, click Add. The Select Topic Recipients dialog opens.

    2. Select the team members from the list, then click Add.

    3. Click OK to return to the New Topic dialog.

    4. To assign a priority to the topic, select Low, Normal, or High from the Priority drop-down list box.

    5. To specify a topic status, select either Active or Closed from the drop-down list box. The default status is Active.

  7. (Optional) If your company uses the application’s repository customization feature, your administrator may have created additional topic properties. If this is the case, select the Custom tab.

    1. Double-click the name of a custom property. The Edit Property dialog opens.

    2. Select a new value for this property. For integer, text, and real fields, Value is a text box. For enumerated types and user IDs, it is a list box. For dates and times, Value has a date check box and a time check box, each of which is followed by a date or time in the format for your locale.

    3. Repeat steps a and b for other custom properties.

  8. (Optional) Select the Attachments tab if you want to attach a file or graphic with your topic.

    1. Click Add. The Open dialog displays.

    2. Enter the attachment name in the File Name text box.

    3. Click Open.

    4. Repeat the previous steps for additional attachments.

  9. (Optional) Select the Comment tab to add additional notes or a comment in the Comment For New Revision text box.

  10. When the information is complete, click OK. This action enters the new topic in the upper pane.

    11. If the tree format is selected, the topic title, your user name, and the time stamp display. If the list format is selected, the list displays the same information, but includes one additional column, Description, which shows the first few words in the topic text.
